alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 6:03PM MST until September 23 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 603 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain of up to 2 inches across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Camp Creek, Desert Mountain and Seven Springs. This includes the following streams and drainages... Grapevine Wash, South Fork Sheep Creek, Galloway Wash, Lime Creek, Skunk Creek, Verde River, Sycamore Creek, Apache Wash, Davenport Wash, Seven Springs Wash, New River, Blue Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Cave Creek, North Canyon Creek, Deadman Creek, Indian Spring Wash, Sheep Creek, Copper Camp Creek, Deadman Wash, Rodger Creek and Camp Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
